isis.stitle: STEERING COLUMN ASSEMBLY, TILT/TELESCOPING - ProStar - CHECKS AND ADJUSTMENTS - STEERING WHEEL

step1.para: Activate the horn to verify the electrical connection to the horn is complete.
Turn on the turn signals, one at a time, and then operate the flashers.
If the horn and/or turn signals are not functioning properly, verify that the power source is connected and that all electrical connections are properly seated.
Verify the vehicle wheels turn when the steering wheel is turned and that the steering wheel features, such as tilt and telescoping, are also functioning properly.

svcsubproc.title: Steering Wheel - Adjust
svcsubproc.para: Proper steering wheel-to-steering gear alignment is designed into the steering assembly. Following are a few alignment points to check at assembly or when steering wheel alignment is a problem:

step1.para: Test drive the vehicle on a straight and level (no crown) section of road for at least one-quarter mile. Determine if, or how far off center, the steering wheel is when the vehicle is going straight.

If the steering wheel alignment is off, return the vehicle to the work area for further adjustment. Stop the vehicle with front road wheels (not steering wheel) straight ahead as indicated by driving test.

Proper steering wheel-to-steering gear alignment can be accomplished by removing the steering wheel (refer to Steering Wheel - Removal procedure), and reindexing the steering wheel onto the splines of the steering column shaft.
Install the steering wheel (refer to Steering Wheel - Installation procedure).
Test drive vehicle to ensure that proper alignment has been accomplished and that steering is correct.
